distance between adjacent tape rows measured along a track on a recorded data medium
Note 1 to entry: row pitch: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO 2382-12:1988].
Note 2 to entry: 12.01.21 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-2382-12 * 1988 * * * ]
2126080
rubberbanding
result of moving a point or an object in a manner that preserves interconnectivity with other points or objects through stretching, resizing, or reorienting their interconnecting lines
Note 1 to entry: rubberbanding: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-13:1996].
Note 2 to entry: 13.05.14 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-13 * 1996 * * * ]
2123848
rule matching
matching of the goal and the elements of a given problem by cascaded application of a series of if-then rules whose premises are true
Note 1 to entry: rule matching: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-28:1995].
Note 2 to entry: 28.03.21 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-28 * 1995 * * * ]
2120785
rule-based synthesis
method of speech synthesis based on the conversion of a phonetic description to parameters of a speech-production model by means of a set of rules
Note 1 to entry: rule-based synthesis: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-29:1999].
Note 2 to entry: 29.03.07 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-29 * 1999 * * * ]
2123875
rule-based system
production system
knowledge-based system that draws inferences by applying a set of if-then rules to a set of facts following given procedures
Note 1 to entry: rule-based system; production system: terms and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-28:1995].
Note 2 to entry: 28.04.14 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-28 * 1995 * * * ]
2126218
ruler line
line that indicates where the left and right margins and any tab stops are set
Note 1 to entry: ruler line: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-23:1994].
Note 2 to entry: 23.06.19 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-23 * 1994 * * * ]
2125956
run-length encoding
encoding of a digital data stream, which defines that stream in terms of a series of numbers, each representing the length of a sequence of equal value elements
Note 1 to entry: Example: Digital encoding in which each sequence of pixels in a scan line having the same shade of gray is represented as a value of magnitude and a value of length.
Note 2 to entry: The purpose of run-length encoding is to reduce storage and/or transmission requirements.
Note 3 to entry: run-length encoding: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-13:1996].
Note 4 to entry: 13.02.03 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-13 * 1996 * * * ]
2122111
running
pertaining to the task state of an executable task in which the task is currently assigned to a processor
Note 1 to entry: running: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-7:2000].
Note 2 to entry: 07.10.07 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-7 * 2000 * * * ]
2124134
sample
obtain the values of a function for regularly or irregularly spaced distinct values from its domain
Note 1 to entry: Other meanings of this term may be used in particular fields, for example in statistics.

scale factor
scaling factor
number used as a multiplier in scaling

convert a digital signal into a pseudorandom digital signal having the same meaning and the same bit rate in order to facilitate transmission or recording

selection
operation of relational algebra that forms a new relation which is a subset of the entity occurrences of a given relation
Note 1 to entry: Example: Given a relation of "books" containing the attributes "author" and "title", the formation of the subset of the books written by a particular author.
Note 2 to entry: selection: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-17:1999].

Note 2 to entry: 17.07.15 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-17 * 1999 * * * ]
2121915
separate compilation
dependent compilation
compilation of a source module using data representing interface and context relationships from related source modules
Note 1 to entry: Interface and context data are used by the compiler to check validity and to resolve references.
Note 2 to entry: separate compilation; dependent compilation: terms and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-7:2000].
Note 3 to entry: 07.04.70 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-7 * 2000 * * * ]
2126385
separation of duties
dividing responsibility for sensitive information so that an individual acting alone can compromise the security of only a limited portion of a data processing system
Note 1 to entry: separation of duties: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-8:1998].
Note 2 to entry: 08.06.16 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-8 * 1998 * * * ]
2122330
separator
delimiter that prevents adjacent lexical tokens or syntactic units from being interpreted as a single item
Note 1 to entry: Examples: The space character or a format effector.
Note 2 to entry: Contrast with delimiter.
Note 3 to entry: separator: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-15:1999].
Note 4 to entry: 15.01.07 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-15 * 1999 * * * ]
2122197
sequence
place items in an arrangement in accordance with the order of the natural numbers
Note 1 to entry: Methods or procedures may be specified for mapping other natural linear orders onto the natural numbers; then, by extension, sequencing may be, for example, alphabetic or chronological.
Note 2 to entry: sequence: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO 2382-6:1987].
Note 3 to entry: 06.05.03 (2382)

2125565
sequential access
serial access
capability to enter data into a storage device or a data medium in the same sequence as the data are ordered, or to obtain data in the same order as they have been entered

[SOURCE:ISO-2382-12 * 1988 * * * ]
2121665
sequential circuit
logic device whose output values, at a given instant, depend upon its input values and the internal state at that instant, and whose internal state depends upon the immediately preceding input values and the preceding internal state
Note 1 to entry: A sequential circuit can assume a finite number of internal states and may therefore be regarded, from an abstract point of view, as a finite automaton.
Note 2 to entry: sequential circuit: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO 2382-3:1987].
Note 3 to entry: 03.04.02 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-2382-3 * 1987 * * * ]
2122144

Note 2 to entry: 07.12.12 (2382)

2121655
serial
pertaining to a process in which all events occur one after the other
Note 1 to entry: Example: The serial transmission of the bits of a character according to the V24 CCITT protocol.

2123050
servability
serveability
serviceability
ability of a service to be obtained at the request of the user, and to continue to be provided for a requested duration, within specific tolerances and under given conditions
Note 1 to entry: The terms used in IEV 191-19-02 are "serveability performance" and "serviceability performance", and the definition is essentially the same.

2120558
server
in a computer network, functional unit that provides services to workstations, to personal computers or to other functional units
Note 1 to entry: Examples: A file server, a print server, a mail server.
Note 2 to entry: Services may be dedicated services or shared services.
Note 3 to entry: This definition is an improvement of the definition 09.08.18 in ISO/IEC 2382-9:1995.
Note 4 to entry: server: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-18:1999].

2122541
settling time
following the initiation of a specified input signal to a system, time required for the output signal to enter and remain within a specified narrow range centered on its steady-state value
Note 1 to entry: The input may be a step, impulse, ramp, parabola, or sinusoid. For a step or impulse, the range is often specified as ± 2 % of the final steady-state value.
Note 2 to entry: settling time: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO 2382-21:1985].
Note 3 to entry: 21.03.21 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-2382-21 * 1985 * * * ]

Note 1 to entry: Examples: COMMON in Fortran; "compool" in some programming languages; PL/I single variables tagged EXTERNAL; a form of a package in Ada.

2121658
simultaneous
in a process, pertaining to two or more events that occur within the same interval of time, each event handled by a separate functional unit
Note 1 to entry: Example: In the execution of one or more programs, several input-output operations handled by input-output channels, input-output controllers and associated peripheral equipment, may be simultaneous with one another, and with other operations handled directly by the processing unit.

2120656
single-layer perceptron
simple perceptron
perceptron
neural network consisting of one artificial neuron, with a binary output value that is determined by applying a monotonic function to a linear combination of the input values and with error-correction learning
Note 1 to entry: The single-layer perceptron forms two decision regions separated by a hyperplane.
Note 2 to entry: For binary inputs values, the single-layer perceptron cannot implement the non-equivalence operation (EXCLUSIVE OR, XOR).
Note 3 to entry: single-layer perceptron; simple perceptron; perceptron: terms and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-34:1999].
Note 4 to entry: 34.02.27 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-34 * 1999 * * * ]
2120644
single-layered network
layered network having only source nodes and one output layer, without hidden layers
Note 1 to entry: In a single-layered network, only the output layer performs computation.
Note 2 to entry: single-layered network: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-34:1999].
Note 3 to entry: 34.02.15 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-34 * 1999 * * * ]

2123285
slot time
<token-bus network> maximum time any data station must wait for a response from another station
Note 1 to entry: slot time: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-25:1992].
Note 2 to entry: 25.03.15 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-25 * 1992 * * * ]
2123287
slotted-ring network
ring network that allows unidirectional data transmission between data stations by transferring data in predefined slots in the transmission stream over one transmission medium such that the data return to the originating station
Note 1 to entry: slotted-ring network: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-25:1992].
Note 2 to entry: 25.04.02 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-25 * 1992 * * * ]
2125979
smooth shading

Note 2 to entry: 13.02.26 (2382)

2126187
soft hyphen
discretionary hyphen
special character in a word, inserted automatically or by the user to mark where the word can be divided, and displayed as a hyphen when the word must be divided at the end of the line due to lack of space
Note 1 to entry: Soft hyphens are subject to hyphen drop.
Note 2 to entry: soft hyphen; discretionary hyphen: terms and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-23:1994].

space character

2120741
speaker adaptation
method of speech recognition allowing a system to modify recognition models automatically, based on additional speech samples from the speaker

2120764
speaker dependence
degree to which a speech recognizer needs to be trained to the speech patterns of individual users

[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-29 * 1999 * * * ]
2120740
speaker identification
form of speaker recognition which compares a voice sample with a set of voice signatures corresponding to different persons to determine the one who has spoken
Note 1 to entry: speaker identification: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-29:1999].
Note 2 to entry: 29.01.35 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-29 * 1999 * * * ]
2120737
speaker recognition
process of obtaining information on a particular speaker through the analysis of some acoustic features of his or her voice
Note 1 to entry: speaker recognition: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-29:1999].
Note 2 to entry: 29.01.32 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-29 * 1999 * * * ]
2120739
speaker verification
speaker authentication
form of speaker recognition for deciding whether a speech sample was spoken by the person whose identity was claimed
Note 1 to entry: Speaker verification is used mainly to restrict access to information, facilities or premises.
Note 2 to entry: speaker verification; speaker authentication: terms and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-29:1999].
Note 3 to entry: 29.01.34 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-29 * 1999 * * * ]
2120767
speaker-adaptive system
user-tuned system
speaker-independent system capable of modifying and updating its speech template to track differences among speech samples and improve its performance
Note 1 to entry: The capability to improve performance is a kind of learning.
Note 2 to entry: speaker-adaptive system; user-tuned system: terms and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-29:1999].
Note 3 to entry: 29.02.18 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-29 * 1999 * * * ]
2120762
speaker-dependent recognition
recognition of speech samples from a registered user or group of users, based on previous training to their speech patterns
Note 1 to entry: speaker-dependent recognition: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-29:1999].
Note 2 to entry: 29.02.13 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-29 * 1999 * * * ]
2120765
speaker-dependent system
SD system
speaker-trained system
speech recognizer restricted to a registered user or group of users, that has to be trained to their speech patterns
Note 1 to entry: Examples: Single-speaker system, multispeaker system.
Note 2 to entry: speaker-dependent system; SD system; speaker-trained system: terms and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-29:1999].
Note 3 to entry: 29.02.16 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-29 * 1999 * * * ]
2120763
speaker-independent recognition
recognition of speech samples from any user without previous training to his or her speech patterns
Note 1 to entry: speaker-independent recognition: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-29:1999].
Note 2 to entry: 29.02.14 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-29 * 1999 * * * ]
2120766
speaker-independent system
SI system
unrestricted recognition system
speech recognizer opened to unregistered users that can work reliably with users who have never, or seldom, used it
Note 1 to entry: speaker-independent system; SI system; unrestricted recognition system: terms and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-29:1999].
Note 2 to entry: 29.02.17 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-29 * 1999 * * * ]
2120775
speaking mode
any of the three manners of speaking to a speech recognizer, namely, isolated-words mode, contiguous-words mode, or continuous-speech mode
Note 1 to entry: speaking mode: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-29:1999].
Note 2 to entry: 29.02.26 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-29 * 1999 * * * ]
2121576
special character
graphic character that is neither a letter, digit nor blank, and usually not an ideogram
Note 1 to entry: Examples: A punctuation mark, a percent sign, a mathematical symbol.
Note 2 to entry: special character: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-4:1999].

[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-4 * 1999 * * * ]
2121776

programming language that focuses its capabilities on a particular kind of application

Note 3 to entry: 07.01.24 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-7 * 2000 * * * ]
2122665
specification
detailed formulation, in document form, which provides a definitive description of a system for the purpose of developing or validating the system

Note 2 to entry: 20.01.03 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-20 * 1990 * * * ]
2121786
specification language
problem-oriented language, often a computer-processible combination of natural language and artificial language, used for expressing the requirements, design, behavior, or other characteristics of a system or a component and that provides special language constructs and, sometimes, verification protocols used to develop, analyze, and document the specified entities
Note 1 to entry: specification language: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-7:2000].
Note 2 to entry: 07.01.34 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-7 * 2000 * * * ]
2120708
speech
voice patterns in a given natural language or acoustic signals simulating such patterns
Note 1 to entry: speech: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-29:1999].
Note 2 to entry: 29.01.03 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-29 * 1999 * * * ]
2120721
speech analysis
extraction of characteristic parameters of a speech signal
Note 1 to entry: Characteristic parameters include the nature of individual sound segments (vowels and consonants), syllable structure, prosodic features, morpheme structure, the lexicon, syntagms, phrases, clauses, and long-term discourse constraints.
Note 2 to entry: speech analysis: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-29:1999].
Note 3 to entry: 29.01.16 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-29 * 1999 * * * ]
2120753
speech analyzer
speech analysis system
functional unit for speech analysis

Note 2 to entry: 29.02.04 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-29 * 1999 * * * ]
2120714
speech bandwidth
range of speech frequencies that can be transmitted or recorded by a given system
Note 1 to entry: speech bandwidth: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-29:1999].
Note 2 to entry: 29.01.09 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-29 * 1999 * * * ]
2120734
speech clipping
limiting of peak signals to a maximum amplitude value or reduction of signals of less than a certain amplitude value to zero
Note 1 to entry: speech clipping: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-29:1999].
Note 2 to entry: 29.01.29 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-29 * 1999 * * * ]
2120728
speech coding
speech encoding
speech waveform coding
conversion of a digitized speech signal to a sequence of discrete data elements according to a set of rules that allows for reasonable reconstruction of the speech signal
Note 1 to entry: Speech digitizing may be associated with an encoding for speech compression. The term "speech coding" is then often used for the combined operation.
Note 2 to entry: speech coding; speech encoding; speech waveform coding: terms and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-29:1999].
Note 3 to entry: 29.01.23 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-29 * 1999 * * * ]
2120732
speech compression
speech processing technique for transmitting or storing a speech signal over a narrower frequency band or using a smaller amount of bits than would normally be necessary
Note 1 to entry: Examples: Prediction coding, sub-band coding, encoding using formants.
Note 2 to entry: speech compression: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-29:1999].
Note 3 to entry: 29.01.27 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-29 * 1999 * * * ]
2120727
speech digitizing
speech digitization
conversion of analog speech signals to digital signals
Note 1 to entry: speech digitizing; speech digitization: terms and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-29:1999].
Note 2 to entry: 29.01.22 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-29 * 1999 * * * ]
2120713
speech frequency
frequency in the range essential for transmission or recording of speech

[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-29 * 1999 * * * ]

capability of a speech output to be understood correctly, usually measured as a percentage of speech units

[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-29 * 1999 * * * ]

[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-29 * 1999 * * * ]
2120720
speech processing
processing of speech signals such as speech analysis, speech compression, speech recognition, and speech synthesis
Note 1 to entry: speech processing: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-29:1999].
Note 2 to entry: 29.01.15 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-29 * 1999 * * * ]
2120735
speech recognition
automatic speech recognition
conversion, by a functional unit, of a speech signal to a representation of the content of the speech
Note 1 to entry: The content to be recognized can be expressed as a proper sequence of words or phonemes.
Note 2 to entry: This entry is an improved version of the entry 28.01.15 in ISO/IEC 2382-28:1995.
Note 3 to entry: speech recognition; automatic speech recognition; ASR: terms, abbreviation and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-29:1999].
Note 4 to entry: 29.01.30 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-29 * 1999 * * * ]
2123783
speech recognition
automatic speech recognition
perception and analysis, by a functional unit, of the information carried by human voice
Note 1 to entry: The information to be recognized can be a word in a predetermined word sequence, a phoneme of a predetermined language, or sometimes the speaker's identity through the vocal features of that speaker.
Note 2 to entry: speech recognition; automatic speech recognition; ASR: terms, abbreviation and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-28:1995].
Note 3 to entry: 28.01.15 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-28 * 1995 * * * ]
2120754
speech recognizer
speech recognition system
functional unit for speech recognition
Note 1 to entry: A speech recognizer has a speech analyzer among its components and usually matches voice input with characteristic parameters of a speech template.
Note 2 to entry: speech recognizer; speech recognition system: terms and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-29:1999].
Note 3 to entry: 29.02.05 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-29 * 1999 * * * ]
2120744
speech reconstruction
speech restitution

Note 2 to entry: 29.01.39 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-29 * 1999 * * * ]
2120712
speech signal
acoustic signal which carries information in a given language
Note 1 to entry: A speech signal may be a voice signal or an acoustic signal simulating a voice signal.
Note 2 to entry: speech signal: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-29:1999].
Note 3 to entry: 29.01.07 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-29 * 1999 * * * ]

speech spectrogram
utterance spectrogram
graphical representation of frequency features of speech

2120719
speech template
set of prerecorded or rule-based voice characteristics stored in a functional unit for future reference or matching purposes

Note 2 to entry: 29.01.14 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-29 * 1999 * * * ]
2120746
speech training

Note 2 to entry: 29.01.41 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-29 * 1999 * * * ]
2120752
speech understanding
production, by a functional unit, of an interpretation of information conveyed by speech signals
Note 1 to entry: Speech understanding assumes previous extraction of information by the functional unit.
Note 2 to entry: See also speech recognition.
Note 3 to entry: speech understanding: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-29:1999].
Note 4 to entry: 29.02.03 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-29 * 1999 * * * ]
2120796
speech-based alerting
synthesized speech message that warns or informs a user as to the operation of a functional unit or a machine
Note 1 to entry: Example: A message alerting of problems associated with the operation of an automobile.
Note 2 to entry: speech-based alerting: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-29:1999].
Note 3 to entry: 29.03.18 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-29 * 1999 * * * ]
2120751
speech-pattern matching
matching of characteristic parameters extracted from a speech sample with those of a speech template prerecorded in a recognition vocabulary
Note 1 to entry: speech-pattern matching: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-29:1999].
Note 2 to entry: 29.02.02 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-29 * 1999 * * * ]
2120750

STT conversion

Note 2 to entry: 29.02.01 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-29 * 1999 * * * ]
2126170
spelling checker
spellchecker
program in a text processor that verifies the spelling of words in text
Note 1 to entry: Checking may be performed on words as they are being entered, or in subsequent processing.
Note 2 to entry: spelling checker; spellchecker: terms and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-23:1994].
Note 3 to entry: 23.04.07 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-23 * 1994 * * * ]
2120575
spidernet
hybrid of a star network and one or more ring networks, resembling a spider web
Note 1 to entry: A spidernet contains 3 classes of nodes: a central star with m branches, nodes on k inner rings with 4 branches each, and one peripheral ring.
Note 2 to entry: A spidernet may be expanded to higher dimensions.
Note 3 to entry: spidernet: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-18:1999].
Note 4 to entry: 18.03.11 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-18 * 1999 * * * ]
2126425

Note 2 to entry: 08.08.11 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-8 * 1998 * * * ]

2120650
stable state
<artificial intelligence> state in which the connection weights of all artificial neurons remain unchanged
Note 1 to entry: A stable state occurs generally when the weights remain unchanged with further training, but may also occur in normal functioning, such as in a Hopfield network.

stack
pushdown list
list that is constructed and maintained so that the next item to be retrieved is the one most recently inserted

2122403
strong typing
enforcement of the requirement that operands in a language construct must be of data types compatible with those of the operation or have explicitly undergone type conversion before the operation is performed
Note 1 to entry: Example: The strong typing in Ada makes the addition of 2 + 3.5 illegal, because 2 is an integer and 3.5 a real number.
Note 2 to entry: strong typing: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-15:1999].
Note 3 to entry: 15.04.30 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-15 * 1999 * * * ]

2122097
structure chart
hierarchy chart
diagram that identifies the modules, activities, or other entities in a system or program and shows how larger or more general entities break down into smaller, more specific entities
Note 1 to entry: The result is not necessarily the same as that shown in a call graph.

any disciplined approach to software design that adheres to specified rules based on principles such as modularity, top-down design, and stepwise refinement of data, of system structures, and of processing steps

2121794
structured programming
method for constructing programs using only hierarchically arranged constructs each having a single entry point and a single exit point
Note 1 to entry: Three kinds of control flow are used in structured programming: sequential, conditional, and iterative.

2126270
subject
<computer security> active entity that can access objects
Note 1 to entry: Example: A process that involves execution of a program.
Note 2 to entry: A subject may cause information to flow among objects or may change the state of the data processing system.
Note 3 to entry: subject: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-8:1998].
Note 4 to entry: 08.01.30 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-8 * 1998 * * * ]

2122974

construction of a concept classification scheme by means of disjunctive classes of clustered concepts
Note 1 to entry: The goal of taxonomy formation is to achieve maximal simplicity and minimal overlap of distinctive characteristics.
Note 2 to entry: See also conceptual clustering and concept formation.
Note 3 to entry: taxonomy formation: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-31:1997].
Note 4 to entry: 31.01.09 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-31 * 1997 * * * ]
2178050
teacher
entity that teaches
Note 1 to entry: Within a specific context (e.g. collaborative learning) the same person can play the roles of learner and teacher.

2122509
technical process
process
set of operations performed by equipment in which physical variables are monitored or controlled
Note 1 to entry: Examples: Distillation and condensation in a refinery; autopiloting and automatic landing in an aircraft.
Note 2 to entry: process; technical process: terms and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO 2382-21:1985].
Note 3 to entry: 21.01.01 (2382)

2123162
teleconferencing
interactive communication among participants at different locations, using telecommunication facilities
Note 1 to entry: Teleconferencing includes conference calls and video conferencing with still or moving images.

2123157
teletex
electronic mail service that provides letter-quality communications among subscribers
Note 1 to entry: Teletex is an enhanced version of telex. It provides both uppercase and lowercase transmission at higher speeds than telex.
Note 2 to entry: Confusion of this term with teletext should be avoided.
Note 3 to entry: teletex: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-27:1994].
Note 4 to entry: 27.03.02 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-27 * 1994 * * * ]
2123158
teletext
broadcast videography
broadcasting service that provides selectable text material such as news, weather reports, and advertisements, directly to a subscriber's television set
Note 1 to entry: The subscriber must have a special decoder to receive teletext signals.
Note 2 to entry: Confusion of this term with teletex should be avoided.
Note 3 to entry: teletext; broadcast videography: terms and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-27:1994].
Note 4 to entry: 27.03.03 (2382)

2121763
third-generation language
high-level language that has a high ratio of machine instructions to each of its simple statements and that raises the programmer's level of abstraction to focusing attention on the problem to be solved instead of on an intimate knowledge about how a particular computer works
Note 1 to entry: Examples: Ada, BASIC, Fortran, Modula-2, Pascal.

2124074
threshold function
two-valued switching function of one or more not necessarily Boolean arguments that takes the value one if a specified mathematical function of the arguments exceeds a given threshold value, and zero otherwise
Note 1 to entry: Example: The threshold function f(a[subscript 1], ..., a[subscript n]) = 0 if g [smaller or equal] T; f(a[subscript 1], ..., a[subscript n]) = 1 if g > T with g = W[subscript 1]a[subscript 1] + ... + W[subscript n]a[subscript n] where W[subscript 1], ..., W[subscript n] are positive weights for the real arguments a[subscript 1], ..., a[subscript n] and T is the threshold.
Note 2 to entry: threshold function: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO 2382-2:1976].
Note 3 to entry: 02.04.07 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-2382-2 * 1976 * * * ]

2123234
token
in a local area network, specified group of bits serving as a symbol of authority passed successively from one data station to another to indicate the station temporarily in control of the transmission medium
Note 1 to entry: All information is conveyed by frames. Some frames contain a token and no user data, others contain data and no token.
Note 2 to entry: token: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-25:1992].
Note 3 to entry: 25.01.06 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-25 * 1992 * * * ]
2123235
token passing protocol
token passing procedure
in a local area network using a token, set of rules that governs how a data station acquires, uses, and transfers the token
Note 1 to entry: token passing protocol; token passing procedure: terms and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-25:1992].
Note 2 to entry: 25.01.07 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-25 * 1992 * * * ]

[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-25 * 1992 * * * ]
2123286

ring network that allows unidirectional data transmission between data stations, by a token passing protocol, such that the transmitted data return to the originating station

2121177
top-level domain name
attribute of an O/R address identifying the highest hierarchical level in the geographical or organizational structure of the message handling system
Note 1 to entry: In X.400, the top-level domain name is a country name. In Internet, the top-level domain name is either a country name, or an English abbreviation such as "com," "edu," "gov," "mil," "net," or "org."
Note 2 to entry: top-level domain name: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-32:1999].
Note 3 to entry: 32.05.11 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-32 * 1999 * * * ]
2122038
total correctness
correctness proving indicating that a program's output assertions follow logically from its input assertions and processing steps, and that, in addition, the program terminates under all specified input conditions
Note 1 to entry: total correctness: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-7:2000].

2122578
track and hold unit
track and store unit

2123222
transinformation content
transferred information
transmitted information
mutual information
difference between the information content l(x) conveyed by the occurrence of an event x, and the conditional information content l(x,y) conveyed by the occurrence of the same event, given the occurrence of another event y; in mathematical notation, this measure is T(x,y) = l(x) - l(x,y)
Note 1 to entry: The two events x and y are particularly a message at the message source of a channel and a message at the message sink of the channel.
Note 2 to entry: The transinformation content can also be expressed as T(x,y) = l(x) + l(y) - l(x|y) where l(y) is the information content of the event y. From this follows that it is symmetric in x and y: T(x,y) = T(y,x)
Note 3 to entry: transinformation content; transferred information; transmitted information; mutual information: terms and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-16:1996].
Note 4 to entry: 16.04.07 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-16 * 1996 * * * ]

2121093
two-out-of-five code
binary-coded decimal notation in which each decimal digit is represented by a binary numeral consisting of five bits out of which two are of one kind, conventionally ones, and three are of the other kind, conventionally zeros
Note 1 to entry: The usual weights are 6-3-2-1-0, except for the representation of zero which is then 00110.

2122852
underflow
<calculators> state in which the calculator shows a zero result for the most significant part of a number, while the least significant part of the number is dropped
Note 1 to entry: Example: If the calculator output capacity is four digits, the number .0000432 will be shown as .0000.
Note 2 to entry: underflow: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO 2382-22:1986].
Note 3 to entry: 22.03.31 (2382)

2121434

in a particular context, all entities that are of interest
Note 1 to entry: Example: If the area of interest is "finance", the universe of discourse would be "all financial aspects of an organization".
Note 2 to entry: A universe of discourse may include many entity worlds, possibly including entities that are not yet perceived or considered.

2126364
virus
program that propagates itself by modifying other programs to include a possibly changed copy of itself and that is executed when the infected program is invoked
Note 1 to entry: A virus often causes damage or annoyance and may be triggered by some event such as the occurrence of a predetermined date.
Note 2 to entry: virus: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-8:1998].
Note 3 to entry: 08.05.47 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-8 * 1998 * * * ]
2126400
virus signature
unique bit string that is common to each copy of a particular virus and that may be used by a scanning program to detect the presence of the virus
Note 1 to entry: virus signature: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-8:1998].
Note 2 to entry: 08.06.31 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-8 * 1998 * * * ]
2122351
visibility

Note 2 to entry: 15.02.17 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-15 * 1999 * * * ]

timer which monitors the state of a signal or a functional unit for inactivity or delay of response beyond a specified duration
Note 1 to entry: Upon lapse of the specified duration, the watchdog timer may activate an alarm or cause a redundant functional unit to take over the functional unit being monitored.

2122404
weak typing
relaxation of the rules of strong typing
Note 1 to entry: Example: Weak typing may permit the addition of an integer and a floating-point number without explicit type conversion of one of the two operands.
Note 2 to entry: In weak typing, there may or may not be implicit type conversion.
Note 3 to entry: weak typing: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-15:1999].

2122156
write
<preparation and handling of data> make a permanent or transient recording of data in a storage device or on a data medium
Note 1 to entry: The phrases "to read to" and "to read from" are often distinguished from the phrases "to write to" and "to write from" only by the viewpoint of the description. For example, the transfer of a block of data from internal storage to external storage may be called "writing to the external storage" or "reading from the internal storage," or both.
Note 2 to entry: write: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO 2382-6:1987].
Note 3 to entry: 06.01.02 (2382)

2126162
WYSIWYG
what-you-see-is-what-you-get
capability of a text processor to continually display text as it will be printed
Note 1 to entry: WYSIWYG provides a constant display whereas print preview is a function that must be requested by the user.
Note 2 to entry: WYSIWYG; what-you-see-is-what-you-get: terms and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-23:1994].
Note 3 to entry: 23.03.07 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-23 * 1994 * * * ]
2124064
zero
<data processing> number that when added to or subtracted from any other number does not alter the value of that other number
Note 1 to entry: Zero may have different representations in computers such as positively or negatively signed zero (which may result from subtracting a signed number from itself) and floating-point zero (in which the fixed point part is zero while the exponent in the floating-point representation may vary).
Note 2 to entry: zero: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO 2382-2:1976].
Note 3 to entry: 02.03.11 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-2382-2 * 1976 * * * ]
2122211
zero suppression

Note 1 to entry: zero suppression: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO 2382-6:1987].
Note 2 to entry: 06.06.08 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-2382-6 * 1987 * * * ]
2122850
zero suppression function
function that allows the process by which unwanted zeros are omitted from the printed or displayed result of a calculation
Note 1 to entry: zero suppression function: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO 2382-22:1986].
Note 2 to entry: 22.03.29 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-2382-22 * 1986 * * * ]
2122062
zero-address instruction
instruction that has no address part
Note 1 to entry: Examples: Certain instructions for a stack machine; a HALT instruction.
Note 2 to entry: zero-address instruction: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-7:2000].
Note 3 to entry: 07.09.12 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-7 * 2000 * * * ]
2122208
zerofill
fill unused storage locations with the representation of the character denoting zero
Note 1 to entry: zerofill: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO 2382-6:1987].
Note 2 to entry: 06.06.05 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-2382-6 * 1987 * * * ]
2125662
zone punch
hole punched in one of the upper three card rows of a twelve-row punch card
Note 1 to entry: zone punch: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO 2382-12:1988].
Note 2 to entry: 12.06.12 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-2382-12 * 1988 * * * ]
2126128
zooming
progressively scaling the entire display image to give the visual impression of movement of display elements toward or away from an observer
Note 1 to entry: The scaling value should be the same in all directions.
Note 2 to entry: zooming: term and definition standardized by ISO/IEC [ISO/IEC 2382-13:1996].
Note 3 to entry: 13.05.62 (2382)
[SOURCE:ISO-IEC-2382-13 * 1996 * * * ]
